Body: You had 26 bags with equal number of cookies. If you had 15 candies and 52 cookies in total
Question: How many cookies does each bag have?

Body: He then went to see the oranges being harvested. He found out that they harvest 38 sacks per day and that each sack containes 42 oranges.
Question: How many sacks of oranges will they have after 49 days of harvest?

Body: There were 16 roses and 3 orchids in the vase. Jessica cut some more roses and orchids from her flower garden. There are now 7 orchids and 13 roses in the vase.
Question: How many orchids did she cut?

Body: Jack received 10 emails in the morning, 5 emails in the afternoon and 4 emails in the evening.
Question: How many more emails did Jack receive in the afternoon than in the evening?

Body: Faye was placing her pencils into rows with 22 pencils in each row. She had 6 packs of pencils each one having 14 pencils.
Question: How many pencils does she have?

Body: A farmer had 160 tomatoes in his garden. If he picked 56 of them yesterday and 41 today.
Question: How many did he have left after yesterday's picking?

Body: Each pot has 40 flowers in it. There are 400 flowers in total.
Question: How many pots are there in all?

Body: 15 campers went rowing in the morning. Some more campers went rowing in the afternoon. If a total of 32 campers went rowing that day
Question: How many campers went rowing in the afternoon?

Body: Because of the decision Sofia asked the students to suggest specific types of food. If 479 students suggested adding mashed potatoes while 489 suggested adding bacon to the menu
Question: How many more students suggested bacon than those that suggested mashed potatoes?

Body: Ed had 5 more marbles than Doug. Doug lost 3 of his marbles at the playground. If Ed had 27 marbles
Question: How many marbles did Doug have initially?
